On Monday 31 October 2005 15:05, Elliotte Harold wrote:
> Chris Dollin wrote:
> > What would you choose to do about an extension point that should
> > only be used by people who know what they're doing? You have to
> > /offer/ it as an extension point - eg declare a method as `protected` -
> > but that doesn't [have to] mean it's open for all comers.
>
> If it's useful, documented, and committed then add it. However, do make
> sure it is thoroughly and completely documented. Do not rely on people
> subscribing to mailing lists or reading the source code.

Do not rely on people reading the documentation, because they don't.

-- 
Chris "it's all paraphernalia" Dollin
